alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Keokuk; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 11:38PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Henry, southeastern Keokuk, southwestern Washington and northern Jefferson Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1138 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Maharishi Vedic City, or near Fairfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fairfield and Richland around 1150 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pleasant Plain, Brighton, Wayland and Coppock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern Iowa.
